segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, and water is pouring onto the floor, but she doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, and yet she keeps polishing that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s lost in thought or just ignoring everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, but she’s too absorbed to see it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while the kitchen is turning into a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and soon the whole floor will be slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to turn off that faucet before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she wakes up from her daze before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between her and the kids is almost funny, but it’s also kind of sad.
segments.speaker: PAR
